title: Every time I reboot, Phone gives a notification for voicemail even though I have none
content:
This is a fairly recent phenomenon. In the past, if I delete all voicemails, Phone doesn't give any new notifications for voicemail.

Recently, this has changed. I restart my phone every day (which prevents certain problems). However, now, every time I restart, Phone gives a notification that I have voicemail. I have checked, more than once, and I really don't have any voicemail! (I always delete voicemail once I've listened to it.)

How can I stop Phone from giving me this spurious message when I restart?
